oai_dc:dc.dc:title: .52 caliber Confederate carbine made in Gallatin, TN
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Made at "Sumner Armory, Tenn," by gunsmith A. I. Heath, this is a locally produced firearm from Gallatin, Tenn. manufactured for Confederate use. These are quite rare since the armory factory was disbanded after the fall of Fort Donelson. Has military brass butt plate and patch box with "A. I. Heath" incised on top of barrel along with "Sumner Armory Tenn." Heath served in Co. E, 9th Tenn. Cav. Regt., CSA under the command of Gen. John Hunt Morgan.
